profile_positions.location: Noordwijk aan Zee, South Holland, Netherlands
profile_positions.title: TRUTHS Principal Instrument Engineer

profile_positions.description:
In charge of the Sentinel 3 New Generation Optical payload (both AOLCI and ALSTR instruments) during the Phase 0.
Payload Engineer for the Scout 1 CubeMAP mission over the Phase B1.
Support on various predevelopments and reviews withing the Agency.
profile_positions.title: EO Optical Payload Engineer

profile_positions.description:
In charge of the development of engineer and technician team around the Photonics and Nuclear subjects within Bertin Systèmes et Instrumentation Business Unit.
Participation to numerous projects and tenders as Optical Engineer/Technical Leader or Reviewer in the frame of Spatial, Defense, Big Science fields and of Product Development.
profile_positions.title: Photonic and Nuclear Team Leader

profile_positions.description:
Technical manager of one of the optical ground support equipment dedicated to the spectroradiometric calibration (VIS, SWIR, IR) of the FCI (Flexible Combined Imager), an hyperspectral imager of MTG (Meteosat Third Generation) programm. Customer: Thalès Alénia Space/ESA.
Beside, I am responsible of the optical parts in two other space projects: another OGSE for project EnMAP (German Earth observation satellite with OHB as customer). And I have participated to 3 offers on space projects (including OGSE GESTA dedicated to IRS).
And to finish, I have participated to two internal projects closely related to microscopy and to the design of an optical objective for french defense Laser Megajoule project (for diagnostics purposes).
profile_positions.title: Technical manager and optical engineer

profile_positions.description:
My PhD was dealing with the development of an highly sensitive holographic microscope based on the principle of synthetic aperture imaging. The goal was to be able to make some 3D images of samples through complex media (scattering and inhomogeneous) like biological samples.
PhD advisors: Eric LACOT and Olivier JACQUIN.

Beside, I was teaching assistant at CPP (Cycle Préparation Polytechnique) of Grenoble. I have participated to electronics, optical and electromagnetic courses. In addition, I was in charge of a second year student during 3 months who was doing an internship in the lab. To finish, I was a reviewer for OSA (Optical Society of America).
profile_positions.title: Teacher assistant INPG

profile_positions.location: Aix en Provence (Z.I. des miles), France
profile_positions.description:
The purpose of this internship of seven months was the design of a spectrometer for the simultaneous detection of war gases. An important part was the analyzing of the state of the art (wide on all spectroscopic techniques including IR and Raman) and the experimental validation of the theory.
Tutor: David Anthoine
profile_positions.title: Internship (engineer)

profile_positions.description: Realization of an optical trap for cold atoms. Tutor: Randall G. Hulet
profile_positions.title: Internship
